forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Cloudy. Low around 55, with temperatures rising to around 57 overnight. West southwest wind around 16 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Light Rain then Mostly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 8am. Mostly cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The dawning hours in Downtown San Francisco whisper the promise of a rainy day, the air infused with a crispness that stirs the senses. A muted palette greets you outside as clouds gather overhead, cloaking the city in a soft, shrouded embrace. As the early morning light drifts slowly into view, the temperature lingers around a cool 55 degrees, hinting at a sheltered chill that follows a breeze gently bustling through the streets. What glimpses of the Golden Gate might be visible are softened by low-hanging clouds, hinting at a transient marine layer that drifts with the wind.

As the day unfolds, expect the warmth of the sun to remain elusive, perhaps peeking through the veil by afternoon, only to be muted by the bite of the wind. The forecast recommends light layers: a well-loved sweater under a sturdy coat, perhaps even a scarf to ward off the morning chill. Those venturing out might find solace in a quiet café, a space where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee mingles with the soft ticking of the clock, or in the quiet corners of a bookshop, where the world outside fades into background murmurs. It’s a day that calls for an invitation to engage with small joys, where the rainfall becomes a soothing soundtrack to the gentle rhythm of days gone by.
